page.title: 19School Leavers
page.content: Every year about 350 pupils have the option of leaving Bedlingtonshire High School. The latest breakdown for this figure is as follows; last year l00 pupils opted to return to school for further study; l60 took up a place on a government scheme, 45 found full-time employment; 25 were unemployed and 20 had either left the area or were untraceable. Teachers felt that most of the children who left school were genuinely looking for jobs. Pupils who stay on into the 6th Form are advised to get as many qualifications as possible. Between May l984 and May l985 there was an increase in the number of unemployed school leavers in the Northern Region.
